snippet: The decision will most likely raise the costs for the ratings company to defend itself and exposes it to the potential headache of multiple judgments and conflicting rulings.
abstract: United States District Judge Jesse M Furman deals setback to Standard & Poor's by ruling that lawsuits accusing company of inflating its credit ratings during financial crisis belong back in state courts.
lead_paragraph: The decision will most likely raise the costs for the ratings company to defend itself and exposes it to the potential headache of multiple judgments and conflicting rulings.

headline.main: Judge Returns S.&P. Suits to Multiple State Courts
headline.print_headline: Judge Returns S.&P. Suits to Multiple State Courts

keywords.value: Credit Ratings and Credit Rating Agencies
keywords.name: subject
